prompt: <description>Part 1: Rectangular Prism with a Flat Top and Bottom Step 1: Create the coordinate system Begin by creating a new coordinate system at the origin, with euler angles set to [0, 0, 0] and translation vector set to [0, 0, 0]. Step 2: Create the 2D sketch for part 1 Using the coordinate system defined above, create a new 2D sketch. The sketch should contain six faces (face_1 to face_6), arranged in the following manner: - face_1: This face is made up of one loop (loop_1), consisting of one arc (arc_1), two lines (line_1 and line_2) and one more arc (arc_2), all closed to form a curved section. The dimensions are as follows: - arc_1: The start point is [0.0, 0.075], mid point is [0.022, 0.022], and end point is [0.075, 0.0]. - line_1: The start point is [0.075, 0.0], and end point is [0.525, 0.0]. - arc_2: The start point is [0.525, 0.0], mid point is [0.578, 0.022], and end point is [0.6, 0.075]. - line_2: The start point is [0.6, 0.075], and end point is [0.6, 0.75]. - face_2: This face is a rectangle bounded by line_2 from face_1 and a new line connecting [0.6, 0.75] and [0.0, 0.75]. - face_3: This face is a rectangle bounded by line_4 from face_1 and a new line connecting [0.0, 0.075] and [0.0, 0.75]. - face_4: This face is a rectangle bounded by lines connecting the endpoints of each of the previous faces, i.e., the start and end points of line_2 and line_3. - face_5: This face is a rectangle bounded by lines connecting the endpoints of line_1 and a new line from the endpoint of arc_2 to the endpoint of line_4. - face_6: Create the final face, a line joining the start and endpoints of arc_1 and arc_2. Step 3: Scale the 2D sketch Scale the 2D sketch by a factor of 0.75 using the sketch_scale parameter. Step 4: Transform the 2D sketch to a 3D sketch Transform the scaled 2D sketch into a 3D sketch using the euler angles and translation vector from the initial coordinate system. Step 5: Extrude the 2D sketch Extrude the 2D sketch by 0.06 units in the direction of the normal to create the 3D model for part 1. Step 6: Document part properties Document the following properties for part 1: - Shape: A rectangular prism with a flat top and bottom. The front face is angled at 45 degrees. - Length: 0.75 units - Width: 0.75 units - Height: 0.06 units Step 7: Determine operation for joining with preceding CAD model Fusion of part 1 with the preceding CAD model is performed by creating a new body, taking precedence over any existing solids.</description>
